ygData.subject: RE: Pixie/Lullaby theory (long)
ygData.msgSnippet: ... I always thought this was due to biasing caused by Cha and the bug/nerf.  e.g. 50% of the time nothing happens due to the song being bugged/nerfed.  The
ygData.messageBody:
On Thu, 9 Dec 1999, Kimes, Dean W. wrote:
>
> that's the case. Although from the testing I did, the effect was either
> full duration or 0 duration. nothing in between. I think that makes it

I always thought this was due to biasing caused by Cha and the
bug/nerf. e.g. 50% of the time nothing happens due to the
song being bugged/nerfed. The remaining 50%, my Cha is high
enough to cause the song to last the full duration.

I used Pixie Strike a lot to pause battles with mammoths when
I was L28. Most of the time it was resisted or lasted the
full duration, but there were many times when it only lasted 3
or 6 seconds (I'd get another song started and the mammoth
would break free, or I'd play another song and start Strike
again and the mammoth would break free before the Strike
took).

--
John H. Kim
kim@...
